security: This material contains information affecting the National Defense of the United States within the meaning of the Espionage Laws, Title 18, U.S.C. Secs. 793 and 794, the transmission or revelation of which in any manner to an unauthorized person is prohibited by law.
summary: An intelligence cable reports on the cost of mobilization for the Cuban armed forces in 1964 and early 1965, noting efforts to economize, with specific figures on mobilization expenses and related field comments about an anticipated invasion attempt.
summary_one_paragraph: This intelligence information cable, dated January 19, 1965, details the estimated cost of mobilization for the Cuban armed forces in 1964, reporting that it cost the Cuban government approximately $5.01 pesos per man per day. It highlights that the 32-day mobilization of 51,000 men in the spring of 1964 cost the Ministry of the Armed Forces a minimum of $8,176,320 pesos. The cable also mentions a later mobilization of 17,000 men for nine days in late December 1964 and early January 1965, noting these mobilizations occurred around the time of an anticipated invasion attempt led by Manuel Ray Rivero.
title: Cost of Mobilization of Cuban Armed Forces and Effort to Economize
